channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Senate to vote on competing health care proposals as ACA subsidies deadline approaches
item.description: Democrats and Republicans have put forward competing health care bills in Congress to address rising costs, but both are expected to fail.
item.content:encoded: Democrats and Republicans have put forward competing health care bills in Congress to address rising costs, but both are expected to fail.
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Sen. Jeanne Shaheen warns millions could lose coverage as ACA votes near defeat
item.description: With ACA tax credits set to expire, Sen. Jeanne Shaheen says premiums are "doubling, tripling" and warns "millions" could lose coverage if Congress fails to act.
item.content:encoded:
With ACA tax credits set to expire, Sen. Jeanne Shaheen says premiums are "doubling, tripling" and warns "millions" could lose coverage if Congress fails to act.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: President Trump says he's going to play a role in the sale of CNN's parent company
item.description: President Trump is lashing out at CNN and pledging to be involved in the looming fight over the cable network's parent company.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is lashing out at CNN and pledging to be involved in the looming fight over the cable network's parent company.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Elizabeth Warren says both bids to buy Warner Bros. Discovery are bad for consumers
item.description: Sen. Elizabeth Warren cautions that the sale of Warner Bros. Discovery to either Netflix or Paramount Skydance could reduce competition and concentrate power over what films and news American see.
item.content:encoded:
Sen. Elizabeth Warren cautions that the sale of Warner Bros. Discovery to either Netflix or Paramount Skydance could reduce competition and concentrate power over what films and news American see.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Colorado ranchers say wolves are killing livestock. The state is stepping in to help
item.description: Two years after residents voted to reintroduce wolves in Colorado, ranchers there say too many of their cows are being killed. The state is now hiring people on horseback to help.
item.content:encoded: Two years after residents voted to reintroduce wolves in Colorado, ranchers there say too many of their cows are being killed. The state is now hiring people on horseback to help.
item.dc:creator: Halle Zander

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Senate to vote on two health care proposals Thursday to address rising cost, the Fed approves its third straight interest rate cut, Trump says the U.S. seized an oil tanker off the Venezuelan coast.
item.content:encoded: Senate to vote on two health care proposals Thursday to address rising cost, the Fed approves its third straight interest rate cut, Trump says the U.S. seized an oil tanker off the Venezuelan coast.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: New film tells the story of the desperate attempt to rescue a girl in Gaza
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with the director of "The Voice of Hind Rajab," a film based on the true story of Palestinian emergency workers trying to save a girl in Gaza.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with the director of "The Voice of Hind Rajab," a film based on the true story of Palestinian emergency workers trying to save a girl in Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Farmers say Trump administration's $12 billion bailout won't fix long-term problems
item.description: The Trump administration is giving farmers a $12 billion bailout. Critics say the money won't be enough, won't be distributed fairly and won't address long-term problems.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is giving farmers a $12 billion bailout. Critics say the money won't be enough, won't be distributed fairly and won't address long-term problems.
item.dc:creator: Frank Morris

item.title: Jury selection begins in trial of judge accused of helping a man evade immigration
item.description: Jury selection gets underway today and tomorrow for the trial of Milwaukee judge Hannah Dugan. She's accused of helping a man in her courtroom evade U.S. Immigration agents last April.
item.content:encoded: Jury selection gets underway today and tomorrow for the trial of Milwaukee judge Hannah Dugan. She's accused of helping a man in her courtroom evade U.S. Immigration agents last April.
item.dc:creator: Maayan Silver

item.title: Report finds 'inhuman' conditions at two Florida immigration facilities
item.description: A new report reveals the conditions at two immigration facilities in Florida. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Amy Fischer of Amnesty International USA about the findings.
item.content:encoded: A new report reveals the conditions at two immigration facilities in Florida. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Amy Fischer of Amnesty International USA about the findings.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel
